intro: Cayaponia nitida, commonly known as the white cayaponia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, white, five-petaled flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Cayaponia nitida is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
